content.rendered:
We are delighted to confirm that we can provide a full range of 2D and 3D vessel incident analyses using a combination of in-house and proprietary software.

If necessary, to augment the vessel’s voyage data recorder (VDR) or electronic charting system, we can obtain and examine independent AIS data to support the investigation.

Our capability extends to the analysis of forces in mooring lines, either generated by environmental conditions or a passing vessel. We can also independently verify business interruption rather than relying on the claimant’s data.

At a glance, our analysis covers:

  • Ship to ship collision
  • Ship to fixed structure allision
  • Passing vessel incidents
  • Mooring investigations
  • Anchor drag and subsea damage capability
  • Business interruptions

For any questions, suggestions or requests, please reach out to us: analysis@aqualisbraemar.com

excerpt.rendered: We are delighted to confirm that we can provide a full range of 2D and 3D vessel incident analyses using a combination of in-house and proprietary software.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Double whammy of Aqualis expertise
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Aqualis Aberdeen General Manager, Martin G. Brown and Marine Manager, Ken Roby, addressed the Marine Safety Forum (MSF) in Aberdeen on the 24th of November on “The Challenges Associated with Quayside Moorings for Drilling Rigs and Vessels”.  During the present low oil price a number of drilling rigs (semis and…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Wind turbine installation vessel launching & construction supervision contract
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Ouyang Offshore Co., Ltd. today launched its new-build wind turbine installation vessel, OuYang 1, at Dayang Offshore Equipment Co., Ltd.’s yard in Jiangsu, China. Further, the Chinese shipowner has awarded AqualisBraemar a contract to supervise the construction of a second wind turbine installation vessel, OuYang 2.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar beefs up ports & harbours offering to tackle renewables rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to ramp up its ports and harbours unit and combine resources and know-how with its offshore wind consultancy unit OWC, following a surge in assignments driven by renewable energy developments.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Brocque Preece
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I’m a naval architect based in London and work within AqualisBraemar’s Ports & Harbours team which typically gets involved in risk and engineering studies surrounding ports and harbour facilities, or incident investigation for port and harbour related claims.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Dropped Objects Inspection and Management Systems Audit conducted by AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Our Offshore Technical Services division recently assisted an international operator offshore West Africa on one of their contracted drilling units. There had been numerous incidents over the preceding six months that thankfully did not result in any personnel injury but were of growing concern to the operator. AqualisBraemar conducted a…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OuYang 1 jacking trial completed
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We have successfully completed the jacking trial of wind turbine installation vessel OuYang 1. AqualisBraemar was engaged by Ouyang Offshore Co. Ltd. to supervise the construction and the jacking trial of the self-elevating wind turbine installation vessel. OuYang 1 is a four-legged, DP1, self-propelled vessel with a working depth of 50 metres.
